title: Introduction to Machine Learning-Based TRIP/TWIP Titanium Alloy Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic materials engineering and machine learning concepts comprehension
context.additional_context: Requires interaction design optimized for smartphone-based real-time video lecture environments

learning_goals: Learners must explain step-by-step the process of predicting three mechanical properties of titanium alloys—yield strength, tensile strength, and elongation—with over 80% accuracy using the XGBoost model, and derive prediction results for five or more alloy samples using Python code.

Learners should explain the operational principles of the TPE (Tree-structured Parzen Estimator) algorithm, propose three hyperparameter optimization scenarios applicable to materials design problems, and describe the expected effects of each scenario with quantitative metrics (e.g., 20% improvement in computational efficiency).
Analyze the effects of alloy composition/heat treatment conditions on TRIP/TWIP mechanisms and tensile properties

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
